Description: Alabaster head of the Egyptian goddess Isis, with twisted locks of hair falling onto her shoulders and a fringed shawl knotted between her breasts.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Robert Murdoch Smith
Excavated by: Cdr Edwin A Porcher
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (1436)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2016, 19 May-27 Nov, BM exhibition Sunken Treasures
